channel.title: Onionshare doesnt connect to the Tor controller
channel.description:
**Expected behavior:**
1. change the OnionShare settings to Connect using control port, as per whonix wiki to make OnionShare work. 2. Test Tor Settings with following output: Congratulations, OnionShare can connect to the Tor controller. Tor version: 0.4.1.5 Supports ephemeral onion services: True Supports stealth onion services: **True** 3. Save 4. Add file to be shared and start sharing
**Current behavior:**
1. change the OnionShare settings to Connect using control port, as per whonix wiki to make OnionShare work. 2. Test Tor Settings with following output: Congratulations, OnionShare can connect to the Tor controller. Tor version: 0.4.1.5 Supports ephemeral onion services: True Supports stealth onion services: **False** 3. Save 4. Add file to be shared and start sharing -> pops up following message: **Error talking to the Tor controller.** **If you're using Whonix, check out whonix wiki (link) to make OnionShare work.**
OnionShare is currently impossible to use. I am using latest Qubes, fully updated.

Then if I try to use it it just quits / crashes.

item.title: Onionshare doesnt connect to the Tor controller
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Version of OnionShare in Debian buster (Whonix is based on buster) is quite old.

1.3.2

https://packages.debian.org/buster/onionshare

Guess: Installation of a newer version of OnionShare might fix this.

Possibility: OnionShare’s onion-grater profile lacks whitelisting of some Tor control protocol commands required for stealth onion services. It’s been a some time since I tested these last time.

To debug:
Watch onion-grater’s log on Whonix-Gateway ™ while using it.

sudo journalctl -f -u onion-grater

Related:

Whonix – 5 Nov 19

OnionShare

Using OnionShare in Whonix ™.

//cc @mig5
